condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities and schools, particularly in rural areas, increase use of “basic” sanitation and practise handwashing with soap

description.narrative: Household sanitation continues to progress rapidly, including an average of a 9% increase in three districts supported by the MOH-District-UNICEF-SFH implementation program in 2020. COVID-19 has provided a significant opportunity to increase awareness on the importance of handwashing with soap. While short-term changes are observed, more will need to be done to catalyze this emergency-driven behaviour into a long-term habit. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020

title.narrative: % of UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations: (a) provided with access to appropriate sanitation facilities and living in environments free of open defecation, (b) provided with menstrual hygiene services, (c) provided with access to appropriate WASH facilities for males and females and hygiene in schools, temporary learning spaces and other child-friendly spaces
Ratio of female to male headed households with at least basic sanitation
% of rural districts with access to at least two affordable sanitation slab products
% of schools with single-sex basic sanitation
Child-sensitive national risk management plans addressing risks related to WASH in emergencies are in place
